title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 15 September 2016 - XWiki
content:
<Denis> has quit  
00:46 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
00:46 <Denis> has quit  
04:56 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
07:29 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:02 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
08:19 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:43 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:01 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:16 <vmassol> good morning  
09:45 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:47 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
10:06 <vmassol> guys I'm having a hard time deciding on a location for the new script api to check if XAR export is available in the wiki. If you could have a quick look at http://markmail.org/message/relaoly3au6qh33w and let me know what you think, that would help me fix XWIKI-13695 Thanks!  
10:09 <vmassol> just replied with another idea  
10:19 <vmassol> tmortagne: Could you tell me where XarScriptService is used? I couldn't find that  
10:21 <vmassol> ah wait I forgot to check somewhere  
10:22 <vmassol> found it  
10:43 <vmassol> tmortagne: does it make sense to you that I add my api to XarScriptService and split xwiki-platform-xar into xwiki-platform-xar-model  + xwiki-platform-xar-script  (and add a dep on oldcore in xwiki-platform-xar-script)?  
10:45 <tmortagne> should be OK for now I guess even if it's going to add a very different abstraction level to the current script service which is only about XAR format right now  
10:45 <tmortagne> but script service is not really the kind of thing you use outside of XWiki  
10:49 <vmassol> ok  
10:53 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:18 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:25 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:45 <vmassol> evalica: fyi the 'recommended" badge doesn't look so good with the "imported…" message. Example: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/LDAP/Authenticator/  
11:45 <vmassol> (small detail)  
11:45 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
11:47 <msmeria> has quit  
11:47 <evalica> vmassol: I think the problem is the imported message location, rather than Recommended  
12:18 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
12:22 <vmassol> evalica: ok so we'll need to find a new place for that message  
12:22 <vmassol> or a different visual  
13:01 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
13:01 <Denis> has quit  
14:05 <xwikiorg\_guest\_6> has joined #xwiki  
14:05 <xwikiorg\_guest\_6> hi there, @tmortagne @vmassol  
14:06 <xwikiorg\_guest\_6> thanks for helping me out yesterday, I'm the guy with the permission problems  
14:08 <vmassol> hey  
14:09 <xwikiorg\_guest\_6> how are you doing :)  
14:09 <vmassol> good, but depends of what you'll ask :)  
14:09 <xwikiorg\_guest\_6> actually I just came here to thank you haha  
14:09 <vmassol> haha  
14:10 <vmassol> you got me!  
14:10 <xwikiorg\_guest\_6> :P!!!  
14:44 <tmortagne> xwikiorg\_guest\_6: you're welcome :)  
15:13 <vmassol> habdling it  
15:18 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: re liimits app, would be nice to show a screenshot when both users and wikis have limites  
15:18 <vmassol> \*limits  
15:18 <gdelhumeau> the limits are not displayed in the same place  
15:18 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: also WDYM by " However, an administrator of the wiki would be able to uninstall it! " ?  
15:19 <gdelhumeau> you see the users limits only on the user admin  
15:19 <gdelhumeau> and the wiki limits on the create wiki page  
15:19 <gdelhumeau> so you cannot see both in the same time  
15:19 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: ah ok it's not clear  
15:19 <vmassol> from the screenshots  
15:19 <vmassol> :)  
15:19 <gdelhumeau> for the other question  
15:19 <vmassol> maybe you should add some text to explain this  
15:20 <vmassol> I thought the user limit was displayed for all admin ui pages  
15:20 <gdelhumeau> Imagine you are a cloud hoster and you want to limit the instances, the best is to put the jar in WEB-INF/lib  
15:20 <gdelhumeau> if you install it via EM, then your client will be able to uninstall it  
15:20 <vmassol> sure it's just that the text is not clear  
15:20 <vmassol> let me fix it  
15:20 <gdelhumeau> yes please :)  
15:25 <vmassol> done  
15:25 <vmassol> check if you like it  
15:27 <Pbas> Hello (still searching right access problem) with xwiki 8.2.1 I have this kind of encoding problem : https://snag.gy/YaetqU.jpg but it seem that "xwiki.encoding = UTF-8"  on tomcat is not enough (http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Encoding#HTomcat). Anyone have this problem?  
15:30 <Pbas> ho maybe: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13557  
15:30 <vmassol> wrong tomcat version?  
15:30 <vmassol> (Pbas)  
15:30 <vmassol> see the red box on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationTomcat  
15:30 <Pbas> I use apache-tomcat-8.0.36  
15:31 <vmassol> yep wrong  
15:31 <vmassol> go talk to tomcat and tell them to fix the bug I reported :)  
15:31 <vmassol> (bug == big regression)  
15:31 <msmeria1> has quit  
15:31 <Pbas> ok  
15:31 <vmassol> all xwiki users should do that  
15:32 <vmassol> that'll help convince them to fix it quicky  
15:32 <vmassol> they're still hesitating  
15:32 <Pbas> ok I think my access right problem is linked to this (I hope)  
15:33 <Pbas> I checked with http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Check+Security+Cache  
15:34 <Pbas> and difference between 7.0.1 and 8.2.1 is "Cached Access Entry: " at page level  
15:34 <Pbas> but mayb I'm wrong, anyway I didn't manage to reproduce my issue on jetty package  
15:35 <vmassol> ok too bad  
15:35 <Pbas> ok I will follow your link to tomcat  
15:40 <vmassol> cool  
15:49 <Denis1> has quit  
15:50 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
15:52 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: I like it :)  
15:59 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: ok cool  
16:23 <edvorg> has quit  
16:31 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
16:35 <Pbas> once again: xwiki task force save me! :)  
16:36 <Pbas> with apache-tomcat-8.0.33 my strang problem with access right are resolved  
16:36 <Pbas> except of course "+" icon  
16:36 <Pbas> thxs  
16:38 <vmassol> cool  
16:38 <Pbas> next time I must read dephly xwiki.org ppage :-/  
16:39 <vmassol> :)  
16:40 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
16:41 <acotiuga> Anyone available to review this PR: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/pull/535?  
16:53 <mflorea> has quit  
16:54 <acotiuga> has quit  
17:21 <blabla2[m]> has quit  
17:21 <M-jsimard> has quit  
17:21 <M-cjd> has quit  
17:21 <Craeckie[m]> has quit  
17:42 <bezourox> has joined #xwiki  
17:43 <bezourox> Hi, having a problem with LDAP config. I used LDAP application from xwiki GUI, but have this message when I saved settiongs : LDAP authentication is not enabled. Please set LDAP as authentication service in xwiki.cfg  
17:44 <bezourox> so I edited XWIKI.cfg to uncomment this line : xwiki.authentication.ldap=1 and restart tomcat, but always same message  
17:44 <bezourox> any idea ?  
17:46 <vmassol> checking build failure in platform on ci  
17:49 <vmassol> grrrrr  
17:49 <vmassol> cycle!  
17:49 <tmortagne> bezourox: this message is not related to xwiki.authentication.ldap but to xwiki.authentication.authclass  
17:50 <tmortagne> see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/LDAP/Authenticator/  
17:50 <vmassol> ah yes  
17:50 <vmassol> fixing  
17:51 <vmassol> tmortagne: I don't remember. Do we have a rule for not putting any JAR dep in xwiki-paltform-web?  
17:51 <vmassol> (I want to add xwiki-platform-xar-script since it's used by some vms in there)  
17:51 <bezourox> tmortagne: from Montauban ?  
17:52 <tmortagne> vmassol: I don't know if the rule is written somewhere but xwiki-paltform-web is not supposed to containg any jar yes  
17:52 <vmassol> ok then I need to add that dep to enterprise-web  
17:53 <vmassol> but it looks weird  
17:53 <vmassol> not to have deps in platform-web for stuff required by vms  
17:53 <tmortagne> vmassol: and xwiki-platform-distribution-war  
17:53 <vmassol> (yes thanks for reminding me about this one)  
17:56 <tmortagne> vmassol: if the Maven WAR plugin was not so dumb when handling WAR dependencies sure we could put jar in xwiki-platform-web directly :)  
17:57 <bezourox> tmortagne: same problem after uncomment  
17:59 <vmassol> hmm I'll also need to add it to the pom of the packager plugin  
17:59 <vmassol> I mean to the PackageMojo  
18:00 <tmortagne> bezourox: did you restarted ?  
18:27 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:39 <Aranjedeath> has joined #xwiki  
18:44 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
18:58 <tmortagne> has quit  
19:21 <blabla2[m]> has joined #xwiki  
19:38 <jonesmeier> has joined #xwiki  
19:45 <jonesmeier> hi, does the current version of XWiki export the stats when doing an export from the admin menu ? just noticed they didn't make it after importing from 6.1 a while back, and thought it would be nice  
20:08 <Enygma`> has quit  
20:15 <evalica> has quit  
20:56 <Chris[m]> has joined #xwiki  
20:56 <Craeckie[m]> has joined #xwiki  
20:56 <jihad[m]> has joined #xwiki  
20:56 <M-cjd> has joined #xwiki  
20:57 <M-jsimard> has joined #xwiki  
20:57 <M-mouhb> has joined #xwiki  
20:57 <M-vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
20:57 <M-yflory> has joined #xwiki  
21:20 <Slashman> has quit  
22:36 <vmassol> jonesmeier: no export doesn't export stats, see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Backup  
22:37 <vmassol> specifically http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Backup#HUsingtheXWikiExportfeature  
22:44 <vmassol> gtg nn  
22:44 <vmassol> has quit  
22:45 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
22:45 <vmassol> has quit  
23:45 <sagarhani> has quit  
23:48 <sagarhani> has joined #xwiki
